classDescription: This description is not yet complete. Thankfully Barbarian Players can't read.

textElements.regularText:
At the start of the Battle the Barbarian enters into a controlled Rage that builds up during the Fight and allows him to shrug of certain amount of damage and unleash it against his enemies. However the Barbarian needs to remain discipline while raging if he builds up too much he might go into an uncontrollable frenzy.
Rage builds up during the fight and is denoted by a number, at the start of combat the Barbarian’s Rage is 0. The Barbarian gains rage via the following things:

bulletPoints: For every unique negative status effect that lingers on the Barbarian at the start of the Barbarian’s [TURN] they gain 1 Rage.
The first time during a [ROUND] they target an enemy with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] or a Weapon Attack using a thrown weapon, they gain 1 Rage.
The first time during a [ROUND] the Barbarian recieves damage they gain 1 Rage.
Falling Unconcious reduces the Barbarian’s rage to 0.

textElements.regularText: When the Barbarians Rage exceeds 4+[LEVEL] they risk entering a frenzy. If at the start of their turn their Rage is higher than their Rage Limit they can make a [WILLPOWER] [SAVE], where the [DT] is equal to 5 + their current Rage. On a fail they enter a frenzy which has the following effects:

bulletPoints: At the start of the Barbarian’s Turn they have to move to the nearest creature (roll on a tie) and make as many [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] as possible against that creature. Each attack has to use the resentful strike class maneuver (even if you don’t know it).
At the start of their next turn they have to repeat the [WILLPOWER] [SAVE] and on a success end the frenzy.

textElements.regularText: A warrior who excells when they are in a frenzy and can control it more.
deep connection to a ancestral spirit or other mystical figure that is stronger during the rage.
Can harness the powers of the elements during their rage

The Barbarian gains resistance against physical damage equal to half their [CON]. Additionally the Barbarians Rage allows him to recover from recent wounds to sustain them in the fight for longer. At the start of the Barbarian’s [TURN] he regains [HP] he lost last round up to twice their current Rage.
The Berserker excells when in a frenzy and it now has the following changes:

bulletPoints: When the Barbarian’s Rage exceeds the Frenzy threshold they can choose automatically fail the [WILLPOWER] [SAVE] and enter the Frenzy.
Instead of the closest creature, they target the closest enemy creature.
While the Barbarian still has to perform as many [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] as possible against the target, they don’t have to use the Resentful Strike Class Maneuver.
The first Class Maneuvers they perform during their turn costs 1 Rage less.

textElements.regularText: When raging becomes closer to their ancesctor/persons they have close contact to. Rage effect depends on alignment.

This barbarian has a deep connection to an elemental plane and can manifest that element when raging. At the start of their Rage choose one Element and you gain benefits depending on the chosen element which lasts until the end of the battle.

bulletPoints: Fire: Enemies within 3m recieve fire damage equal to their current Rage. [AURA].
Earth: Friendly creatures within 3m recieve [THP] equal to their current Rage. [AURA]
Water: Enemies within 3m have their [MP] reduced equal to their Rage, however not lower than 2 [MP]

Air: Friendly creatures 3m gain [MP] equal to half their current Rage. Additionally their long jump distance is increased by a number of meters equal to their rage and the high jump by half their rage. [AURA]

textElements.regularText: You can add to half your [LEVEL] to your Initiative Bonus and additionally in the first combat round they have an 2 extra [MP] unless they are suprised.
You can increase one of your following Attributes by 1: [STR], [AGI], [CON], [PER]

When suffer a point of [EXHAUSTION] you can instead make a [TOUGHNESS] [SAVE] against a [DT] 15. If this [SAVE] was successful you don’t suffer the point of [EXHAUSTION], however the [DT] to resist next time is increased by 5. When you complete a Long Rest the [DT] resets again.
Each time you make a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] you can add your [LEVEL] to the damage.
The Threshold for the Frenzy now is always 5 and doesn’t increase with your [LEVEL] anymore additionally while in a frenzy you gain the following benefits.

bulletPoints: The Barbarian has 1 extra [AP] per turn.
The Barbarian recieves 1 extra Rage at the start of their turn.
Every Class Maneuver they perform during their turn costs 1 Rage less.
The Barbarian is immune to the [STUNNED I], [CRIPPLED I], [FRIGHTENED I], [FRIGHTENED II] and [FRIGHTENED III] status effects.

textElements.regularText: Your connection to the elements deepens now during your turn you can spend 5 Rage and 1 [AP] to can gain an additional elemental effect that is active during the duration of your Rage. However Fire and Water cannot be active at the same time as well as Earth and Air. Additionally the effect of each Element is getting stronger:

bulletPoints: Fire: The Aura increases to 4.5m and each time the Barbarian hits a creature with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] they recieve [BURNING I] for 2 turns.
Earth: The Aura increases to 4.5m and each time they hit a creature with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] and that attack is higher than the creatures [TOUGHNESS] they are [STUNNED I] for 1 turn.
Water: The Aura increases to 4.5m and each time they hit a creature with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] and that attack is higher than the creatures [HARDNESS] they are [RESTRAINED I] by ice for 1 turn.

Air: The Aura increases to 4.5m and each time they hit a creature with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] a target of their choice within the area effect is hit by a lightning strike for lightning damage equal 1d6 + Rage.

textElements.regularText: At the start of the combat the Barbarian recieves enugh Rage to instantly trigger their frenzy, once they have done this they can’t use this ability again until the next Long Rest . Additionally while in a frenzy the Barbarian gains the following benefits

bulletPoints: The Barbarian recieves 3 extra Rage at the start of their turn instead of 1.
The [HP] they regain because of their Rage is doubled.
The Barbarian is immune to the [STUNNED II] and [STUNNED III] status effects.
Dropping to Deaths Door during a frenzy causes no Exhaustion (however recieving damage during Deaths Door still does)

textElements.regularText: Your connection to the elements deepens and each elements effect is improved.

bulletPoints: Fire: The Aura increases to 6m and in addition to setting a target on fire after a successful [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] they trigger a firey explosion in a 3m radius around the target that hits every creature except you with the area. If the attack is higher than the creatures [DODGE] they take fire damage equal to 2d6 + Rage [HALF] .
Earth: The Aura increases to 6m and poisonous mist is additionally swirling around you decreasing the [TOUGHNESS] of enemies within the area by half your Rage.
Water: The Aura increases to 6m and a small snowstorm or maelstrom swirls around you decreasing the [DODGE] of enemies within the area by half your Rage.
Air: The Aura increases to 6m and now 3 lightning strikes appear after each [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] but they can’t strike the same target twice.

classTechniquesDescription: The Barbarian can expend his Rage to perform Class Techniques which empower can empower his attacks or allow to perform great physical feats.

classTechniques.name: Resentful Strike
classTechniques.description: After successfully making a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] you deal 1d6+([LEVEL]/6) bonus physical damage per Rage spent.

classTechniques.name: Armor of Fury
classTechniques.description: You gain [CON]+[LEVEL] [THP] for every Rage you spend

classTechniques.name: Furious Charge
classTechniques.description: You use the Dash Ability for 0 [AP] , every time this ability is used again in the same turn, the Rage cost is increased by 1.

classTechniques.name: Walk it off
classTechniques.description: You can remove one Tier I Status Effect effecting you. When using 2 [AP] and 4 Rage you can end a Tier II Status Effect. When using 3 [AP] and 8 Rage you can end a Tier III Status Effect.

classTechniques.name: Rage fueled Maneuver
classTechniques.description: When you perform a Martial Maneuver instead of it using your [STAMINA] you can alternatively spend 2 Rage per 1 [STAMINA] cost.

classTechniques.name: Reckless Headbutt
classTechniques.description: Make a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] against your target, on a hit it takes ([STR]/2) * d6 physical damage. Additionally on a hit compare your [TOUGHNESS] to your target's if yours is higher the target recieves the [STUNNED I] status effect, if the target is higher you recieve the [STUNNED I] status effect. On a tie, both are [STUNNED I].

classTechniques.name: Violent Leap
classTechniques.description: You make a regular Jump Move and at end of your Jump Move roll and make a [STR] [MARTIAL TEST]. Every enemy within [MELEE RANGE] of the landing is knocked prone if that roll exceeds their [HARDNESS].

classTechniques.name: Adrenaline Rush
classTechniques.description: If you kill an enemy with a [MELEE MARTIAL ATTACK] , you can use this ability to instantly gain 2 [AP]. You can only use this ability once per turn and only during your turn.

classTechniques.name: Violent Reprisal
classTechniques.description: You can use this [REACTION] when you loose [HP] from a creature within [MELEE RANGE]. You can make a Weapon Attack agaisnt that creature in response dealing extra damage equal to the amount of [HP] you lost.

classTechniques.name: Primal Roar
classTechniques.description: Make a [CON] [MARTIAL TEST]. If that roll is higher than any creature’s [TOUGHNESS] within a 6m cone in front of you. They recieve [CON]*d6 Sonic damage and are [DEAFENED] [HALF].
